Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Low Molecular Weight Dextran Sulfate in Islet Transplantation

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults undergoing islet transplantation. The study was conducted across multiple centers.

Intervention.evidence: Participants received peritransplant intraportal and systemic treatment with either LMW-DS or heparin

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the efficacy and safety of low molecular weight dextran sulfate (LMW-DS) compared to heparin in preventing IBMIR.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the stimulated C-peptide response measured 75±5 days post-transplant.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Due to the open-label design, blinding was not applied.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Twelve participants were randomized to each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome showed no significant difference between LMW-DS and heparin (1.33±1.10 vs. 1.56±1.36 ng/mL, p=0.66).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were comparable, mostly related to immunosuppression.
